macroSpec.desc: Either a decimal value or a token. The decimal values are limited to .25, .5, .75, or 1, while the token values are restricted to 'full'.

A beat location, i.e., [0-9]+(\.?[0-9]*)? The value must fall between 0 and the numerator of the time signature + 1, where 0 represents the left bar line and the upper bound represents the right bar line. For example, in 12/8 the value must be in the range from 0 to 13.
Visual and performance information for a repeated beat symbol.

Either a hexadecimal color value, i.e.., #[0-9A-Fa-f]{6,6} OR a descriptive word, i.e., aqua, black, blue, fuchsia, gray, green, lime, maroon, navy, olive, purple, red, silver, teal, white, or yellow, for colors defined by the HTML 4.01 specification.
One or more values from the list given in the definition of data.COLOR.
360th-unit measure of a circle's circumference; optionally signed decimal number between -360 and 360.
In a guitar chord diagram, a label indicating which finger, if any, should be used to play an individual string. The values 'x' and 'o' indicate stopped and open strings, respectively.

In a guitar chord diagram, the fret where the finger should be placed. Since guitar chord diagrams are limited to the range of frets that fall under the hand, the value here is also limited. The pos (position) attribute on the chordDef element must be used to indicate at which fret this range begins.
Either a token indicating direction of the interval but not its precise value or a decimal value in half steps. Decimal values are permitted to accommodate micro-tuning.
an ID reference
One or more IDREFs
ISO date formats

A duration expressed as a count of measures plus a beat location, i.e., [0-9]+m *\+ *[0-9]+(\.?[0-9]*)?, e.g., dur="1m + 3.5" indicates a duration of 1 measure plus 3 and one half beats or, in other words, on the 2nd half of the 3rd beat of the next measure. The measure number must be in the range of 0 to the number of remaining measures and the beat number must be in the range from 0 to the numerator of the time signature plus 1. For example, for an event starting in the first measure of a piece containing 6 measures in 6/8, the measure number must be between 0 to 5 and the beat number must be within the range from 0 to 7, e.g., "4m+3".
General MIDI instrument names
MIDI quarter notes per minute: positive integer in the range 10-1000
Maxima-long relationship values.
Long-breve relationship values.
The amount of octave displacement; that is, '8' (as in '8va' for 1 octave), '15' (for 2 octaves), or rarely '22' (for 3 octaves).
Rotation or reflection of base symbol values.
The number of panels per page.
Positive decimal number plus '%', i.e., [0-9]+(\.?[0-9]*)?\%
Semibreve-minim relationship values.
The number of slashes to be rendered for tremolandi.
In string tablature, the number of the string to be played, i.e., [1-9]+.
Beats (meter signature denominator) per minute, e.g. 120.
Breve-semibreve relationship values
A positive or negative offset from the value given in the tstamp attribute in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]
a Uniform Resource Identifier, see [RFC2396]
One or more URIs
Accidental attribute values. nf (natural-flat) and ns (natural-sharp) are used to cancel double flats and double sharps, respectively.

rng:choice.a:documentation: triple sharp (written as croix and 2 sharps)
sharp note raised by quarter tone
sharp note lowered by quarter tone
flat note raised by quarter tone
flat note lowered by quarter tone
natural note raised by quarter tone
natural note lowered by quarter tone

macroSpec.desc: Accidental attribute values.

The following list of articulations mostly corresponds to symbols from the Western Musical Symbols portion of the Unicode Standard. The dot and stroke values may be used in cases where interpretation is difficult or not desirable.

rng:choice.a:documentation: main note followed by short slide to higher, indeterminate pitch (Unicode 1D185)
main note preceded by short slide from lower, indeterminate pitch (Unicode 1D186)
main note preceded by "slide" from higher, indeterminate pitch
main note followed by long "slide" to lower, indeterminate pitch
"lip slur" to lower pitch, then return to written pitch
main note followed by quick upward rise, then descent in pitch (Unicode 1D187)

macroSpec.desc: One or more values from the list given in the definition of data.ARTICULATION.
Dots attribute values (number of augmentation dots) (Read, 113-119, ex. 8-21)
Placement of bar lines. The value 'staff' describes the traditional placement of bar lines.

rng:choice.a:documentation: between and across staves as necessary
short line above staff or through top line

macroSpec.desc: Renderings of bar lines. Some values correspond to the Western Musical Symbols portion of the Unicode Standard.
Beam attribute values: initial, medial, terminal. Nested beaming is permitted.
One or more from the list given in the definition of the BEAM datatype.
Boolean attribute values

Values for certainty attribute. Certainty may be expressed by one of the values 'high', 'medium', or 'low'. The value 'unknown' should be used in cases where the encoder does not wish to assert an opinion.
Clef line attribute values. The value must be in the range between 1 and the number of lines on the staff. The numbering of lines starts with the lowest line of the staff.
Clef shape attribute values (Read, p.53-56). Some values correspond to the Unicode Standard.
Tone-cluster rendition.
Renderings of curves
Logical, that is, written, duration attribute values for the CMN repertoire.
Logical, that is, written, duration attribute values for the mensural repertoire.
Enclosures for editorial notes and accidentals
Font family (for text) attribute values. Mup-acceptable values: avantgarde, bookman, courier, helvetica, newcentury, palatino, times.
Font name (for text) attribute values. Mup-acceptable values: rom, ital, bold, boldital
Font style (for text) attribute values. Mup-acceptable values: ital, 'normal' = 'rom' in Mup.
Font weight (for text) attribute values
In string tablature, the fret number, i.e., [1-9]. The value 'o' may be used instead of a numerical value to indicate the open string.
Analytical glissando attribute values

rng:choice.a:documentation: note/chord that's neither first nor last in glissando

macroSpec.desc: Do grace notes get time from the current (acc) or previous (unacc) one?

rng:choice.a:documentation: no interpretation regarding performed value of grace note

macroSpec.desc: Note head shapes. Some values map to Unicode characters, others to Mup characters.
Interrupted neume, i.e. neume written as 2 or more sub-neumes
Interrupted neume forms
A token describing the pitch name, inflection, and octave number of an altered pitch in a key signature.

Key signature may be indicated by a value showing where the key is in the circle of fifths. Mixed key signatures, e.g. those consisting of a mixture of flats and sharps, and key signatures with unorthodox placement of the accidentals (Read, p. 143) must be indicated by setting the key.sig attribute to 'mixed' and providing explicit key signature information in the key.sig.mixed attribute.

Indicates how stems should be drawn when more than one layer is present and stem directions are not indicated on the notes/chords themselves. '1' indicates that there is only a single layer on a staff. '2o' means there are two layers with opposing stems. '2f' indicates two 'free' layers; that is, opposing stems will be drawn unless one of the layers has 'space'. In that case, stem direction in the remaining layer will be determined as if there were only one layer. '3o' and '3f' are analogous to '2o' and '2f' with three layers allowed.
Ligature forms

rng:choice.a:documentation: individual notes are replaced by an oblique figure

macroSpec.desc: Renderings of lines
Mensuration attribute values
Meter.sym attribute values for CMN
MIDI channel numbers
MIDI values are in the following range
Modes
Music font family
Oct attribute values. The default values conform to Acoustical Society of America representation. Read, p. 44.
Page scale factor. Page.scale may be expressed as a percentage of a programmatically-determined "usual" size or as a ratio of virtual units to real-world units.
Values for real-world unit attributes
Pclass (pitch class) attribute values
The pitch names (gamut) used within a single octave. The default values conform to Acoustical Society of America representation.
Gestural pitch names need an additional value for when the notated pitch is not to be sounded.
Pnum (pitch number, e.g. MIDI) attribute values
Location of symbol relative to other notational components.
For musical material designated to appear on another staff, the location of the staff relative to the current one; i.e., the staff above or the staff below.
Location of musical material relative to a staff.
Relative size attribute values

i=initial, m=medial, t=terminal. Number is used to match endpoints of the slur when slurs are nested or overlap, e.g. <note slur='i1 i2'/><note slur='t1'/><note slur='t2'/> encodes the fact that two slurs begin on note 1, one which terminates on note 2 and one which terminates on note 3.
One or more from the list given in the definition of data.SLUR.
Slur direction

Staff location. The value '0' indicates the bottom line of the current staff; positive values are used for positions above the bottom line and negative values for the positions below. For example, in treble clef, 1 = F4, 2 = G4, 3 = A4, etc. and -1 = C4, -2 = B4, and so on.
Stem direction
Stem modification
Which side of stem?

rng:choice.a:documentation: stem attached to left side of note head
stem attached to right side of note head
stem is originates from center of note head

macroSpec.desc: Temperament or tuning system
Text rendition values

rng:choice.a:documentation: quoted; context determines which quotation signs are used

macroSpec.desc: Tie attribute values: initial, medial, terminal
Tie direction
One or more from the list given in the definition of data.TIE.
Tuplet attribute values: initial, medial, terminal
One or more from the list given in the definition of data.TUPLET.
Basic, i.e., single, uninterrupted, neume names
Basic, i.e., single, uninterrupted, neume forms
Distance expressed in terms of staff interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staff lines.

classSpec.desc: Attributes for capturing momentary pitch inflection

attDef.desc: captures a written accidental.

classSpec.desc: Attributes for capturing momentary pitch inflection in the gestural domain

attDef.desc: records the performed pitch inflection when it differs from the written accidental.

classSpec.desc: Attributes supplying pointers to user-defined symbols

attDef.desc: provides a way of pointing to a user-defined symbol. It must contain an ID of a <symbolDef> element elsewhere in the document.

classSpec.desc: Attributes for capturing the written signs that describe the method of performance

attDef.desc: encodes the written articulation(s). Articulations are normally encoded in order from the note head outward; that is, away from the stem. See additional notes at att.vis.note. Only articulations should be encoded in the artic attribute; fingerings should be encoded using the <dir> element.

classSpec.desc: Attributes describing the method of performance

attDef.desc: records performed articulation that differs from the written value.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that record the number of dots of augmentation

attDef.desc: records the number of augmentation dots required by a dotted duration.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that describe the source of an controlled value

attDef.desc: a name or label associated with the controlled vocabulary from which the value is taken.
the web-accessible location of the controlled vocabulary from which the value is taken.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that describe the source of an controlled value

attDef.desc: provides a regularized, authorized value.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that capture the placement of bar lines

attDef.desc: records the location of a bar line.

If takt bar lines are to be used, then the taktplace attribute may be used to denote the staff location of the shortened bar line. The location may include staff lines, spaces, and the spaces directly above and below the staff. The value ranges between 0 (just below the staff) to 2 * number of staff lines (directly above the staff). For example, on a 5-line staff the lines would be numbered 1,3,5,7, and 9 while the spaces would be numbered 0,2,4,6,8,10. For example, a value of '9' puts the bar line through the top line of a 5-line staff.

classSpec.desc: Used by layerDef, staffDef, and scoreDef to provide default values for attributes in the visual domain related to beaming

attDef.desc: encodes whether a beam is "feathered" and in which direction.

valItem.desc: beams lines grow farther apart from left to right
beam lines grow closer together from left to right
beam lines are equally-spaced over the entire length of the beam

attDef.desc: captures beam slope.
contains a reference to a field or element in another descriptive encoding system to which this MEI element is comparable.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that indicate the calendar system of a date or other datable element.

attDef.desc: indicates the calendar system to which a date belongs, for example, Gregorian, Julian, Roman, Mosaic, Revolutionary, Islamic, etc.

classSpec.desc: attributes that can be used to associate a representation such as a name or title with canonical information about the object being named or referenced.

attDef.desc: used to record a value which serves as a primary key in an external database.

classSpec.desc: Used by staffDef and scoreDef to provide default values for attributes in the logical domain related to clefs

attDef.desc: encodes a value for the clef symbol.
contains a default value for the position of the clef. The value must be in the range between 1 and the number of lines on the staff. The numbering of lines starts with the lowest line of the staff.
records the amount of octave displacement to be applied to the clef.
records the direction of octave displacement to be applied to the clef.

classSpec.desc: Used by staffDef and scoreDef to provide default values for attributes in the visual domain related to clefs

attDef.desc: describes the color of the clef.
determines whether the clef is to be displayed.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that record the shape of a clef

attDef.desc: describes a clef's shape.
used to indicate visual appearance. Do not confuse this with the musical term 'color' as used in pre-CMN notation.

indicates this feature is 'colored'; that is, it is a participant in a change in rhythmic values. In mensural notation, coloration is indicated by colored notes (red, black, etc.) where void notes would otherwise occur. In CMN, coloration is indicated by an inverse color; that is, the note head is void when it would otherwise be filled and vice versa.
provides a label for an element. The value may be any string.
provides a name or number designation for an element. While the value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.
provides a base URI reference with which applications can resolve relative URI references into absolute URI references.

classSpec.desc: Attributes shared by events which rely on other events for their existence. For example, a slur/phrase marking must be drawn between or over a group of notes. The slur is therefore a control event.
This attribute class records the position of a feature within a two-dimensional coordinate system.

attDef.desc: indicates the upper-left corner x coordinate.
indicates the upper-left corner y coordinate.
indicates the lower-right corner x coordinate.
indicates the lower-left corner x coordinate.
records the placement of Bezier control points as a series of space-separated xy coordinates, e.g., 19 45 -32 118.

describes a curve as a set of distance values above or below an imaginary line connecting the endpoints of the curve. The bulge attribute must contain one or more decimal values expressed in inter-line units.
describes a curve with a generic term indicating the direction of curvature.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that record the visual rendition of curves

attDef.desc: describes the line style of the curve.
contains the end point of a date range.
contains an upper boundary for an uncertain date.
contains a lower boundary for an uncertain date.
contains the starting point of a date range.

classSpec.desc: Attributes for linking metadata to data

attDef.desc: used to link metadata elements to one or more data-containing elements.

classSpec.desc: provides attributes for elements which may be associated with particular contextual elements within the header

attDef.desc: identifies one or more metadata elements within the header, which are understood to apply to the element bearing this attribute and its content.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that describe distance from the staff

attDef.desc: records the distance from the staff for dynamic marks in 1/2 inter-line units.
records the default distance from the staff of harmonic indications, such as guitar chord grids or functional labels.
determines how far from the staff to render text elements.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that provide a durational default value

attDef.desc: contains a default duration in those situations when the first note, rest, chord, etc. in a measure does not have a duration specified.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that express duration in musical terms

attDef.desc: records the duration of a feature using the relative durational values provided by the data.DURATION datatype.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that record performed duration that differs from a feature's written duration.

attDef.desc: records performed duration information that differs from written duration. Its value may be expressed in any convenient form, such as measures[s]+ beat[s].beatpart, ppq (MIDI clicks), Humdrum **recip values, or MusicXML 'divisions', etc.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that describe duration as a ratio

attDef.desc: along with numbase, describes duration as a ratio. num is the first value in the ratio, while numbase is the second.
along with num, describes duration as a ratio. num is the first value in the ratio, while numbase is the second.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that express duration as a timestamp for the ending point

attDef.desc: records the duration of a feature using the relative durational values provided by the data.MEASUREBEAT datatype.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that capture characters used to enclose symbols having a cautionary or editorial function

attDef.desc: records the characters often used to mark accidentals, articulations, and sometimes notes as having a cautionary or editorial function. For an example of cautionary accidentals enclosed in parentheses, see Read, p. 131, ex. 9-14.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that apply to all written events, e.g., note, chord, rest, etc.
Attributes indicating the attachment of a fermata to the feature

attDef.desc: indicates the attachment of a fermata to this element. If visual information about the fermata needs to be recorded, then a <fermata> element should be employed instead.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that describe the symbol used to group a set of staves

attDef.desc: specifies the symbol used to group a set of staves.

classSpec.desc: Attributes which identify a document hand

attDef.desc: signifies the hand responsible for an action. The value must be the ID of a <hand> element declared in the header.
records horizontal alignment.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that uniquely identify an element

attDef.desc: regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

classSpec.desc: Attributes which identify a MIDI instrument

attDef.desc: provides a way of pointing to a MIDI instrument definition. It must contain the ID of an <instrDef> element elsewhere in the document.

classSpec.desc: Attributes which record the type of an electronic resource

attDef.desc: specifies the applicable MIME (multimedia internet mail extension) type. The value should be a valid MIME media type defined by the Internet Engineering Task Force in RFC 2046.

classSpec.desc: Attributes indicating that elements are semantically linked; that is, while the parts are encoded separately, together they may be thought of as a single intellectual object

attDef.desc: used for linking visually separate entities that form a single logical entity, for example, multiple slurs broken across a system break that form a single musical phrase. Also used to indicate a measure which metrically completes the current one. Record the identifiers of the separately encoded components, excluding the one carrying the attribute.

classSpec.desc: Used by staffDef and scoreDef to provide default values for attributes in the logical domain related to key signatures

attDef.desc: contains an accidental for the tonic key, if one is required, e.g., if key.pname equals 'c' and key.accid equals 's', then a tonic of C# is indicated.
indicates major, minor, or other tonality.
holds the pitch name of the tonic key, e.g. 'c' for the key of C.
indicates where the key lies in the circle of fifths.

Mixed key signatures, e.g. those consisting of a mixture of flats and sharps (Read, p. 143, ex. 9-39), and key signatures with unorthodox placement of the accidentals (Read, p. 141) must be indicated by setting the key.sig attribute to 'mixed' and providing explicit key signature information in the key.sig.mixed attribute or in the <keySig> element. It is intended that key.sig.mixed contain a series of tokens with each token containing pitch name, accidental, and octave, such as 'A4 Cs5 Ef5' that indicate what key accidentals should be rendered and where they should be placed.

classSpec.desc: Used by staffDef and scoreDef to provide default values for attributes in the visual domain related to key signatures

attDef.desc: indicates whether the key signature should be displayed.
determines whether cautionary accidentals should be displayed at a key change.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that record labels for a feature in addition to those found in att.common

attDef.desc: provides a label for a group of staves on pages after the first page. Usually, this label takes an abbreviated form.

classSpec.desc: Language attributes common to text elements

attDef.desc: identifies the language of the element's content. The values for this attribute are language 'tags' as defined in BCP 47. All language tags that make use of private use sub-tags must be documented in a corresponding language element in the MEI header whose id attribute is the same as the language tag's value.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that identify the layer to which a feature applies

attDef.desc: identifies the layer to which a feature applies.

classSpec.desc: Attributes for identifying the staff line with which a feature is associated

attDef.desc: indicates the line upon which a feature stands. The value must be in the range between 1 and the number of lines on the staff. The numbering of lines starts with the lowest line of the staff.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that record the visual rendition of lines

attDef.desc: records the appearance of a line.

classSpec.desc: Attributes common to all linking elements

attDef.desc: defines whether a link occurs automatically or must be requested by the user.

valItem.desc: load the target resource upon user request
do not permit loading of the target resource
behavior other than allowed by the other values of this attribute

attDef.desc: indicates a property of the entire link. The value of the role attribute must be a URI.
defines how a remote resource is rendered.

valItem.desc: load the referenced resource in the same window
embed the referenced resource at the point of the link
do not permit traversal to the referenced resource
behavior other than permitted by the other values of this attribute

attDef.desc: allows the use of one or more previously-undeclared URIs to identify an external electronic object.
in contrast with the role attribute, allows the target resource to be characterized using any convenient classification scheme or typology.

contains a human-readable description of the entire link. A value is optional; if a value is supplied, it should contain a string that describes the resource. The use of this information is highly dependent on the type of processing being done. It may be used, for example, to make titles available to applications used by visually impaired users, or to create a table of links, or to present help text that appears when a user lets a mouse pointer hover over a starting resource.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that describe default typography of lyrics

attDef.desc: describes the alignment of lyric syllables associated with a note or chord.
sets the font family default value for lyrics.
sets the font name default value for lyrics.
sets the default font size value for lyrics.
sets the default font style value for lyrics.
sets the default font weight value for lyrics.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that record the unit of measurement in which a value is expressed

attDef.desc: indicates the units used for a measurement, usually using the standard symbol for the desired unit.

measurement of the horizontal dimension of an entity. This value can only be interpreted meaningfully in combination with the units attribute. The width attribute may be used to capture measure width data for interchange with music printing systems that utilize this information for printing. On <barLine> the width attribute captures the width of the preceding measure.

classSpec.desc: Attributes describing a writing medium, such as pencil or ink

attDef.desc: describes the writing medium.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that record the version of MEI in use

attDef.desc: specifies the version number of the MEI Guidelines in use.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that provide information about a structure's conformance to the prevailing meter.

attDef.desc: indicates the relationship between the content of a staff or layer and the prevailing meter

classSpec.desc: Attributes that provide information about a measure's conformance to the prevailing meter.

attDef.desc: indicates the relationship between the content of a measure and the prevailing meter

indicates whether or not a bar line is "controlling"; that is, if it indicates a point of alignment across all the parts. Bar lines within a score are usually controlling; that is, they "line up". Bar lines within parts may or may not be controlling. When applied to <measure>, this attribute indicates the nature of the right barline but not the left.

classSpec.desc: Used by staffDef and scoreDef to provide default values for attributes in the logical domain related to meter signature

attDef.desc: captures the number of beats in a measure, that is, the top number of the meter signature.
contains the number indicating the beat unit, that is, the bottom number of the meter signature.

classSpec.desc: Used by staffDef and scoreDef to provide default values for attributes in the visual domain related to meter signature

attDef.desc: contains an indication of how the meter signature should be rendered.

valItem.desc: the lower number in the meter signature is replaced by a note symbol
meter signature rendered using traditional numeric values

attDef.desc: determines whether a new meter signature should be displayed when the meter signature changes.
indicates the use of a meter symbol instead of a numeric meter signature, that is, 'C' for common time or 'C' with a slash for cut time.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that record tempo in terms of beats per minute

attDef.desc: used to describe tempo in terms of beats (meter signature denominator) per minute, ala M.M. (Maezel's Metronome).
indicates whether programmatically calculated counts of multiple measures of rest (mRest) and whole measure repeats (mRpt) in parts should be rendered.
used to record a pointer to the regularized form of the name elsewhere in the document.
used to specify further information about the entity referenced by this name, for example, the occupation of a person or the status of a place.
captures written octave information.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that record a default value for octave

attDef.desc: contains a default octave specification for use when the first note, rest, chord, etc. in a measure does not have an octave value specified.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that record placement of notes on a single-line staff

attDef.desc: determines the placement of notes on a 1-line staff. A value of 'true' places all notes on the line, while a value of 'false' places stems-up notes above the line and stems-down notes below the line.

classSpec.desc: Attributes describing the amount and direction of octave displacement

attDef.desc: records the amount of octave displacement.
records the direction of octave displacement.

classSpec.desc: Attributes listing the participants in a user-defined collection

attDef.desc: contains a space separated list of references that identify logical events that participate in a collection, such as notes under a phrase mark.
specifies the intended meaning when the target of a pointer is itself a pointer.

valItem.desc: if the element pointed to is itself a pointer, then the target of that pointer will be taken, and so on, until an element is found which is not a pointer.
if the element pointed to is itself a pointer, then its target (whether a pointer or not) is taken as the target of this pointer.
no further evaluation of targets is carried out beyond that needed to find the element specified in the pointer's target.

remarks.p: If no value is given, the application program is responsible for deciding (possibly on the basis of user input) how far to trace a chain of pointers.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that record written pitch name

attDef.desc: contains a written pitch name.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that record written pitch name and octave number

attDef.desc: captures the placement of the item with respect to the staff with which it is associated.
describes the relative size of a feature.

classSpec.desc: Attributes capturing information regarding responsibility for some aspect of the text's creation, transcription, editing, or encoding.

attDef.desc: captures information regarding responsibility for some aspect of the text's creation, transcription, editing, or encoding. Its value must point to one or more identifiers declared in the document header.
scale factor to be applied to the feature to make it the desired display size.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that describe order within a collection of features

attDef.desc: used to assign a sequence number related to the order in which the encoded features carrying this attribute are believed to have occurred.

classSpec.desc: Attributes for recording the number of slashes that accompany a feature

attDef.desc: indicates the number of slashes to be rendered along with the feature.

classSpec.desc: Attributes for marking the presence of a slur

attDef.desc: indicates that this element participates in a slur. If visual information about the slur needs to be recorded, then a <slur> element should be employed.

classSpec.desc: Attributes for identifying the staff associated with the current feature

attDef.desc: signifies the staff on which a notated event occurs or to which a control event applies. Mandatory when applicable.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that identify location on a staff in terms of lines and spaces

attDef.desc: holds the staff location of the feature.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that identify a relative starting point

attDef.desc: holds a reference to the first element in a sequence of events to which the feature applies.

classSpec.desc: Attributes recording the identifiers of the first and last elements of a sequence of elements to which the current element is associated.

attDef.desc: indicates the final element in a sequence of events to which the feature applies.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that describe the properties of stemmed features; that is, chords and notes

attDef.desc: describes the direction of a stem.
encodes the stem length.
records the position of the stem in relation to the note head(s).
records the output x coordinate of the stem's attachment point.
records the output y coordinate of the stem's attachment point.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that hold associated sung text syllables

attDef.desc: holds an associated sung text syllable.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that describe default text typography

attDef.desc: provides a default value for the font family name of text (other than lyrics) when this information is not provided on the individual elements.
provides a default value for the font name of text (other than lyrics) when this information is not provided on the individual elements.
provides a default value for the font size of text (other than lyrics) when this information is not provided on the individual elements.
provides a default value for the font style of text (other than lyrics) when this information is not provided on the individual elements.
provides a default value for the font weight for text (other than lyrics) when this information is not provided on the individual elements.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that indicate the presence of a tie

attDef.desc: indicates that this element participates in a tie. If visual information about the tie needs to be recorded, then a <tie> element should be employed.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that record a time stamp in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

attDef.desc: encodes the onset time in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional_beat_part]

classSpec.desc: Attributes that record a time stamp in terms of relative or real time.

attDef.desc: used to record the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the file.
used to record the onset time in terms of ISO time since the start of the file.
records the amount of diatonic pitch shift, e.g., C to C = 0, C to D = 1, necessary to calculate the sounded pitch from the written one.
records the amount of pitch shift in semitones, e.g., C to C = 1, C to D = 1, necessary to calculate the sounded pitch from the written one.

classSpec.desc: Attributes for indicating the presence of a tuplet

attDef.desc: indicates that this feature participates in a tuplet. If visual information about the tuplet needs to be recorded, then a <tuplet> element should be employed.

classSpec.desc: Attributes which can be used to classify or sub-classify features

attDef.desc: characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.
provide any sub-classification for the element, additional to that given by its type attribute.
contains the name of a font-family.
holds the name of a font.
indicates the size of a font in printers' points, i.e., 1/72nd of an inch.
records the style of a font, i.e, italic, oblique, or normal.
used to indicate bold type.

classSpec.desc: Attributes describing whether a feature should be displayed

attDef.desc: indicates if a feature should be rendered when the notation is presented graphically or sounded when it is presented in an aural form.
records a horizontal adjustment to a feature's programmatically-determined location in terms of staff interline distance; that is, in units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staff lines.

classSpec.desc: Horizontal offset attributes specified in terms of time

attDef.desc: records a timestamp adjustment of a feature's programmatically-determined location in terms of musical time; that is, beats.
records the vertical adjustment of a feature's programmatically-determined location in terms of staff interline distance; that is, in units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staff lines.

classSpec.desc: Visual offset attributes. Some items may have their location recorded in terms of offsets from their programmatically-determined location. The ho attribute records the horizontal offset while vo records the vertical. The to attribute holds a timestamp offset, the most common use of which is as an alternative to the ho attribute.
Horizontal offset requiring a pair of attributes

attDef.desc: records the horizontal adjustment of a feature's programmatically-determined start point.
records the horizontal adjustment of a feature's programmatically-determined end point.

classSpec.desc: Horizontal offset attributes requiring a pair of attributes specified in terms of time

attDef.desc: records a timestamp adjustment of a feature's programmatically-determined start point.
records a timestamp adjustment of a feature's programmatically-determined end point.

classSpec.desc: Vertical offset attributes requiring a pair of attributes

attDef.desc: records a vertical adjustment of a feature's programmatically-determined start point.
records a vertical adjustment of a feature's programmatically-determined end point.

classSpec.desc: Visual offset attributes. Some items may have their location recorded in terms of pairs of offsets from their programmatically-determined location. The startho and endho attributes record the horizontal offsets of the start and end points of the item, respectively. Similarly, the startvo and endvo attributes record the vertical offsets of the start and end points of the item. The startto and endto attributes hold timestamp offsets, the most common use of which is as alternatives to the ho attributes.

Output coordinate attributes. Some elements may have their exact rendered *output* coordinates recorded. x and y attributes indicate where to place the rendered output. Recording the coordinates of a feature in a facsimile requires the use of the facs attribute.

attDef.desc: encodes an x coordinate for a feature in an output coordinate system. When it is necessary to record the placement of a feature in a facsimile image, use the facs attribute.
encodes an y coordinate for a feature in an output coordinate system. When it is necessary to record the placement of a feature in a facsimile image, use the facs attribute.

classSpec.desc: Output coordinate attributes. Some elements may need 2 coordinate pairs to record their rendered *output* coordinates. The attributes indicate where to place the rendered output. Recording the coordinates of a feature in a facsimile requires the use of the facs attribute.

attDef.desc: encodes the optional 2nd x coordinate.
encodes the optional 2nd y coordinate.
records the function of an accidental.
captures the placement of the accidental relative to the staff.

valItem.desc: above the staff, e.g., musica ficta
below the staff, e.g., musica ficta
on the staff, i.e., traditional placement

classSpec.desc: Logical domain attributes for annot. Values for the type attribute can be taken from any convenient typology of annotation suitable to the work in hand; e.g. annotation, gloss, citation, digression, preliminary, temporary, etc.

attDef.desc: records the appearance and usually the function of the bar line.

classSpec.desc: Logical domain attributes for chord. The artic, dots, and dur attributes encode the written articulations, augmentation dots, and duration values. The beam, fermata, lv, slur, syl, tie, and tuplet attributes may be used to indicate the attachment of these things to this chord. If visual information about these things needs to be recorded, then either the elements corresponding to these attributes or the attributes available in the att.vis.chord class should be employed.

Visual domain attributes for chord. The slur, slur.dir, slur.rend, tie, tie.dir, and tie.rend attributes here are syntactic sugar for these attributes on each of the chord's individual notes. The values here apply to all the notes in the chord. If some notes are slurred or tied while others aren't, then the individual note attributes must be used.

attDef.desc: indicates a single alternative note head should be displayed instead of individual note heads. See Read, p. 320-321, re: tone clusters.
records the function of the clef. A "cautionary" clef does not change the following pitches.
encodes the target note when its pitch differs from the pitch at which the custos appears.
records the function of the dot.
provides a mechanism for linking the layer to a layerDef element.

classSpec.desc: Gestural domain attributes. The tstamp.ges and tstamp.real attributes encode the onset time of the measure. In reality, this is usually the same as the onset time of the first event in the measure.

Logical domain attributes. The n attribute contains a name or number associated with the measure (Read, p. 445). Often, this is an integer, but not always. For example, some measures, especially incomplete measures or those under an ending mark, may have labels that contain an integer plus a suffix, such as '12a'. Measures may even have labels, especially in editorial or analytical uses of MEI, that are entirely non-numeric strings. Measure numbers may be machine-generated instead of encoding them in the markup. However, an explicit measure number should restart numbering with the given value. The join attribute may be used to indicate another measure which metrically completes the current, incomplete one.

attDef.desc: indicates the visual rendition of the left bar line. It is present here only for facilitation of translation from legacy encodings which use it. Usually, it can be safely ignored.
indicates the function of the right bar line and is structurally important.
records performed octave information that differs from the written value.
contains a performed pitch name that differs from the written value.
holds a pitch-to-number mapping, a base-40 or MIDI note number, for example.
used to override the head shape normally used for the given duration.
amount of "padding" to be added, in interline units; that is, in units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staff lines.
states the side of a leaf (as in a manuscript) on which the content following the <pb> element occurs.
indicates whether hash marks should be rendered between systems. See Read, p. 436, ex. 26-3.

classSpec.desc: Gestural domain attributes for scoreDef. The values set in these attributes act as score-wide defaults for attributes that are not set in descendant elements. For example, the grace attribute value here applies to all the grace attribute values in the score (or, more accurately, until the next <scoreDef> element) without having to individually set each note's grace attribute value. The midi.* attributes function as default values when creating sounding output. The tune.* attributes provide the capability of recording a tuning reference pitch.

attDef.desc: holds the pitch name of a tuning reference pitch.
holds a value for cycles per second, i.e., Hertz, for a tuning reference pitch.
provides an indication of the tuning system, 'just', for example.

classSpec.desc: Logical domain attributes for scoreDef in the CMN repertoire. The values set in these attributes act as score-wide defaults for attributes that are not set in descendant elements.
Visual domain attributes for scoreDef in the CMN repertoire

attDef.desc: describes where ending marks should be displayed.

valItem.desc: ending rendered only above top staff
ending rendered above staves that have bar lines drawn across them

attDef.desc: indicates whether measure numbers should be displayed.
sets the default music font name.
sets the default music font size.
indicates whether staves without notes, rests, etc. should be displayed. When the value is 'true', empty staves are displayed.
describes the physical height of the rendered output page.
describes the physical width of the rendered output page.
contains the real-world measurement units (inches, centimeters, millimeters) used to describe the rendered page height, width, and margins.
indicates the amount of whitespace at the top of a rendered score page.
indicates the amount of whitespace at the bottom of a rendered score page.
indicates the amount of whitespace at the left side of a rendered score page.
indicates the amount of whitespace at the right side of a rendered score page.
indicates the number of logical pages to be rendered on a single physical page.
indicates how the page should be scaled when rendered.
describes a note's spacing relative to its time value.
describes the note spacing of output.
sets the minimum amount of space between staves in the same system.
contains a space-separated pair of numbers describing the minimum and maximum amount of space between systems.
describes the amount of whitespace at the left system margin relative to page.leftmar.
describes the amount of whitespace at the right system margin relative to page.rightmar.
describes the distance from page's top edge to the first system; used for first page only.
indicates that staves begin again with this section.
indicates whether a space is 'compressible', i.e., if it may be removed at the discretion of processing software.
provides a mechanism for linking the staff to a staffDef element.

classSpec.desc: Gestural domain attributes for staffDef in the CMN repertoire

attDef.desc: determines whether to display guitar chord grids.
indicates the number of layers and their stem directions.
indicates the number of staff lines.

captures the colors of the staff lines. The value is structured; that is, it should have the same number of space-separated RGB values as the number of lines indicated by the lines attribute. A line can be made invisible by assigning it the same RGB value as the background, usually white.
records whether all staff lines are visible.

records the absolute distance (as opposed to the relative distances recorded in <scoreDef> elements) between this staff and the preceding one in the same system. This value is meaningless for the first staff in a system since the spacing.system attribute indicates the spacing between systems.
indicates whether bar lines go across the space between staves (true) or are only drawn across the lines of each staff (false).
describes the symbols typically used to indicate breaks between syllables and their functions.
records the position of a syllable within a word.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that describe correction and normalization methods

attDef.desc: indicates the method employed to mark corrections and normalizations.

valItem.desc: corrections and normalizations indicated using elements

classSpec.desc: Attributes that indicate whether an event lies under a beam

attDef.desc: indicates that this event is "under a beam".
In the case of cross-staff beams, the beam.with attribute is used to indicate which staff the beam is connected to; that is, the staff above or the staff below.

classSpec.desc: Used by layerDef, staffDef, and scoreDef to provide default values for attributes in the logical domain related to beaming

attDef.desc: provides an example of how automated beaming (including secondary beams) is to be performed.
indicates whether automatically-drawn beams should include rests shorter than a quarter note duration.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that record the visual rendition of beams

attDef.desc: captures whether a beam is "feathered" and in which direction.

valItem.desc: (accelerando) indicates that the secondary beams get progressively closer together toward the end of the beam
(ritardando) means that the secondary beams become progressively more distance toward the end of the beam
(normal) indicates that the secondary beams are equidistant along the course of the beam

attDef.desc: records the slope of the beam.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that capture information about secondary beaming

attDef.desc: presence of this attribute indicates that the secondary beam should be broken following this note/chord. The value of the attribute records the number of beams which should remain unbroken.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that indicate how to render staff lines of the measure containing an element belonging to this attribute class

attDef.desc: "Cut-out" style indicated for this measure.

valItem.desc: the staff lines should not be drawn

classSpec.desc: Attributes that indicate whether to render a repeat symbol or the source material to which it refers

attDef.desc: indicates whether to render a repeat symbol or the source material to which it refers. A value of 'true' renders the source material, while 'false' displays the repeat symbol.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that mark a note or chord as a "grace", how it should "steal" time, and how much time should be allotted to the grace note/chord.

attDef.desc: marks a note or chord as a "grace" (without a definitive written duration) and records from which other note/chord it should "steal" time.
records the amount of time to be "stolen" from a non-grace note/chord.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that indicate the presence of an l.v. (laissez vibrer) marking attached to a feature

attDef.desc: indicates the attachment of an l.v. (laissez vibrer) sign to this element.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that record numbers to be displayed with a feature

attDef.desc: records a number or count accompanying a notational feature

classSpec.desc: Attributes that record the placement and visibility of numbers that accompany a bowed tremolo or tuplet

attDef.desc: states where the tuplet number will be placed in relation to the note heads.
determines if the tuplet number is visible.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that describe the rendition of slurs

attDef.desc: describes the line style of the slur.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that describe the properties of stemmed features; that is, chords and notes

attDef.desc: encodes any stem "modifiers"; that is, symbols rendered on the stem, such as tremolo or Sprechstimme indicators.
contains an indication of which staff a note or chord that logically belongs to the current staff should be visually placed on; that is, the one above or the one below.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that describe the rendition of ties

attDef.desc: describes the line style of the tie
describes the direction in which an arpeggio is to be performed.

valItem.desc: non-arpeggiated style (usually rendered with a preceding bracket instead of a wavy line)

attDef.desc: indicates if an arrowhead is to be drawn as part of the arpeggiation symbol.

indicates the number of slashes required to render the appropriate beat repeat symbol. When a single beat is repeated, consisting of a single note or chord, it is indicated by a single thick, slanting slash; therefore, the value '1' should be used. The following values should be used when the beat is divided into even notes: 4ths or 8ths=1, 16ths=2, 32nds=3, 64ths=4, 128ths=5. When the beat is comprised of mixed duration values, the symbol is always rendered as 2 slashes and 2 dots.
records the amount of detuning. The decimal values should be rendered as a fraction (or an integer plus a fraction) along with the bend symbol.

classSpec.desc: Visual domain attributes. If the bulge or bezier attributes are present, the bend should be rendered as a curve. Otherwise, it should be rendered using lines. The ho and vo attributes describe the visual offset of the entire rendered bend. The endho, endvo and startho, startvo attribute pairs may be used to encode start and end points relative to their programmatic placement. For exact placement of the endpoints of the bend, use the x and y attributes.

attDef.desc: describes the style of the tremolo.

classSpec.desc: Gestural domain attributes for CMN features
Logical domain attributes for CMN features

Visual domain attributes for chord. The slur, slur.dir, slur.rend, tie, tie.dir, and tie.rend attributes here are "syntactic sugar" for these attributes on each of the chord's individual notes. The values here apply to all the notes in the chord. If some notes are slurred or tied while others aren't, then the individual note attributes must be used.

attDef.desc: describes the visual appearance of the fermata; that is, whether it occurs as upright or inverted.

valItem.desc: inverted, i.e., curve or bracket below the dot
upright; i.e., curve or bracket above the dot

attDef.desc: describes the visual appearance of the fermata; that is, whether it has a curved or square shape.

valItem.desc: a curve above or below the dot
a bracket above or below the dot

attDef.desc: describes the style of the tremolo.
records a text string, such as 'gliss', that accompanies the glissando mark.
captures the visual rendition and function of the hairpin; that is, whether it indicates an increase or a decrease in volume.

classSpec.desc: Visual domain attributes. The startho and startvo attributes record the horizontal and vertical offsets of the left end, endho and endvo record the horizontal and vertical offsets of the right end, and the opening attribute records the width of the opening in staff inter-line units. The x and y attributes give the absolute coordinates of the left side of the top line of the hairpin while x2 and y2 record the coordinates of the right side of the top line. The position of the end points of the bottom line can be calculated using the top line coordinates and the value of the width attribute.

attDef.desc: specifies the distance between the points of the open end of a hairpin dynamic mark.

classSpec.desc: Logical domain attributes. The pedal setting, i.e., flat, natural, or sharp, for each diatonic pitch name is indicated by the seven letter-named attributes.

attDef.desc: indicates the pedal setting for the harp's C strings.
indicates the pedal setting for the harp's D strings.
indicates the pedal setting for the harp's E strings.
indicates the pedal setting for the harp's F strings.
indicates the pedal setting for the harp's G strings.
indicates the pedal setting for the harp's A strings.
indicates the pedal setting for the harp's B strings.

classSpec.desc: Analytical domain attributes. Use the n attribute to explicitly encode this measure's position in a string of measures containing only <mRest> elements.

attDef.desc: When the block attribute is used, combinations of the 1, 2, and 4 measure rest forms (Read, p. 104) should be rendered instead of the modern form or an alternative symbol.
indicates that this element participates in a glissando.

indicates whether the octave displacement should be performed simultaneously with the written notes, i.e., "coll' ottava". Unlike other octave signs which are indicated by broken lines, coll' ottava typically uses an unbroken line or a series of longer broken lines, ending with a short vertical stroke. See Read, p. 47-48.
records the position of the piano damper pedal.

valItem.desc: depress then immediately release the pedal

classSpec.desc: Visual domain attributes. The place attribute captures the placement of the pedal marking with respect to the staff with which it is associated. Modern publishing standards require the place to be 'below'; however, for transcriptions of manuscript works, this attribute class allows the full range of values.

attDef.desc: determines whether piano pedal marks should be rendered as lines or as terms.

valItem.desc: continuous line with start and end positions rendered by vertical bars and bounces shown by upward-pointing "blips"
pedal down and half pedal rendered with "Ped.", pedal up rendered by "*", pedal "bounce" rendered with "* Ped."
pedal up and down indications same as with "pedstar", but bounce is rendered with "Ped." only

classSpec.desc: Used by scoreDef and staffDef to provide default description of piano pedal rendition

attDef.desc: determines whether piano pedal marks should be rendered as lines or as terms.

valItem.desc: continuous line with start and end positions rendered by vertical bars and bounces shown by upward-pointing "blips"
pedal down and half pedal rendered with "Ped.", pedal up rendered by "*", pedal "bounce" rendered with "* Ped."
pedal up and down indications same as with "pedstar", but bounce is rendered with "Ped." only

classSpec.desc: Attributes used by scoreDef and staffDef to provide default information about rehearsal numbers/letters

attDef.desc: describes the enclosing shape for rehearsal marks.
determines whether to display guitar chord grids.

classSpec.desc: Visual domain attributes for slur. The vo attribute is the vertical offset (from its normal position) of the entire rendered slur/phrase mark.
Logical domain attributes for CMN features
Logical domain attributes for staffDef in the CMN repertoire
Visual domain attributes for staffDef in the CMN repertoire

Visual domain attributes. The vo attribute is the vertical offset (from its normal position) of the entire rendered tie. The startho, startvo, endho, and endvo attributes describe the horizontal and vertical offsets of the start and end points of the tie in terms of staff interline distance; that is, in units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staff lines. Startto and endto describe the start and end points in terms of time; that is, beats.

attDef.desc: records the duration of the tuplet using the optionally dotted, relative durational values provided by the data.DURATION datatype. When the tuplet duration is "irrational", @dur may contain multiple, space-separated values that add up to the total duration. For unmeasured music, use the attributes found in att.duration.ratio (num and numbase) to capture the tuplet's duration instead of this attribute.
used to state where a tuplet bracket will be placed in relation to the note heads.
states whether a bracket should be rendered with a tuplet.
determines if the tuplet duration is visible.
controls how the num:numbase ratio is to be displayed.

valItem.desc: only the num attribute is displayed, e.g., '7'
both the num and numbase attributes are displayed, e.g., '7:4'

attDef.desc: records the duration of the tuplet using the optionally dotted, relative durational values provided by the data.DURATION datatype. When the tuplet duration is "irrational", a @dur may contain multiple, space-separated values that add up to the total duration. For unmeasured music, use the attributes found in att.duration.ratio (num and numbase) to capture the tuplet's duration instead of this attribute.
provides an indication of the function of the ligature.
describes the maxima-long relationship.
describes the long-breve relationship.
describes the semibreve-minim relationship.
describes the breve-semibreve relationship.

classSpec.desc: Visual domain attributes. These attributes describe the physical appearance of the mensuration sign/time signature of mensural notation.

attDef.desc: specifies whether a dot is to be added to the base symbol.
indicates whether the base symbol is written vertically or horizontally.
describes the rotation or reflection of the base symbol.
the base symbol in the mensuration sign/time signature of mensural notation.

classSpec.desc: Used by staffDef and scoreDef to provide default values for attributes in the logical domain related to mensuration

attDef.desc: determines if a dot is to be added to the base symbol.
describes the rotation or reflection of the base symbol.
the base symbol in the mensuration sign/time signature of mensural notation.
indicates the number lines added to the mensuration sign. For example, one slash is added for what we now call 'alla breve'.

classSpec.desc: Used by staffDef and scoreDef to provide default values for attributes in the visual domain related to mensuration

attDef.desc: indicates whether the base symbol is written vertically or horizontally.
holds the staff location of the mensuration sign.
describes the relative size of the mensuration sign.
indicates this element's participation in a ligature.

classSpec.desc: Logical domain attributes. These attributes describe augmentation or diminution of the normal value of the notes in mensural notation as a ratio.

attDef.desc: states how many spaces are covered by the rest.

classSpec.desc: Logical domain attributes for a score in the mensural repertoire. The values set in these attributes act as score-wide defaults for attributes that are not set in descendant elements. The tempus, prolatio, modusmaior, and modusminor attributes specify the relationship between the four principle levels of note value, i.e., the long, breve, semibreve and minim, in mensural notation. Modusminor describes the long-breve relationship, while tempus describes the breve-semibreve, and prolatio the semibreve-minim relationship, respectively. Modusmaior is for the maxima-long relationship. The proport.* attributes describe augmentation or diminution of the normal value of the notes in mensural notation. The num and numbase attributes provide default values.
Visual domain attributes for scoreDef in the mensural repertoire
Logical domain attributes for staffDef in the mensural repertoire

attDef.desc: Together, proport.num and proport.numbase specify a proportional change as a ratio, e.g., 1:3. Proport.num is for the first value in the ratio.
Together, proport.num and proport.numbase specify a proportional change as a ratio, e.g., 1:3. Proport.numbase is for the second value in the ratio.

classSpec.desc: Visual domain attributes for the mensural repertoire

attDef.desc: provides a subclass or functional label for the neume.
records the name of the neume.
provides a subclass or functional label for the neume.
records the name of the neume.

classSpec.desc: Common analytical attributes. When the meiLinkAlign module is used, the when attribute is also a member of this attribute class.

attDef.desc: points to an element of which the current element is a copy.
used to point to other elements that correspond to this one in a generic fashion.
used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.
points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.
points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

classSpec.desc: Attributes describing the harmonic function of a single pitch

attDef.desc: describes harmonic function in any convenient typology.
encodes the harmonic interval between this note and other pitches occurring at the same time.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that provide for description of intervallic content

attDef.desc: encodes the melodic interval from the previous pitch. The value may be a general directional indication (u, d, s) or a precise numeric value in half steps.
describes melodic function in any convenient typology.
holds pitch class information.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that specify pitch using sol-fa

attDef.desc: contains sol-fa designation, e.g., do, re, mi, etc., in either a fixed or movable Do system.
records the written accidental associated with an upper neighboring note.
records the written accidental associated with a lower neighboring note.

Traditionally, the 'normal' mordent is written as a short wavy line with a vertical line through it and the inverted mordent is written without the vertical line. However, the meaning of these signs is sometimes reversed. See Read, p. 245-246. Another attribute in the visual domain would be necessary in order to be completely explicit about which visual symbol is actually to be rendered.

valItem.desc: inverted mordent, e.g., performed as the principal note, followed by its upper neighbor, with a return to the principal note
"normal" mordent, e.g., performed as the written note, followed by its lower neighbor, with a return to the written note

attDef.desc: When the long attribute is set to 'yes', a double or long mordent, consisting of 5 notes, is indicated.
When the delayed attribute is set to 'true', the turn begins on the second half of the beat. See Read, p. 246.
indicates the style of the turn.

valItem.desc: inverted turn, e.g., begins on the note below the written note
"normal" turn, e.g., begins on the note above the written note

classSpec.desc: Attributes common to all elements representing variant readings

attDef.desc: classifies the cause for the variant reading, according to any appropriate typology of possible origins.

classSpec.desc: Attributes common to elements that may refer to a source

attDef.desc: contains a list of one or more pointers indicating the sources which attest to a given reading. Each value should correspond to the ID of a <source> element located in the document header.

classSpec.desc: Attributes describing the nature of an encoded scholarly intervention or interpretation

attDef.desc: signifies the degree of certainty or precision associated with a feature.
indicates the nature of the evidence supporting the reliability or accuracy of the intervention or interpretation. Suggested values include: 'internal', 'external', 'conjecture'.

classSpec.desc: Attributes for the identification of a causative agent

attDef.desc: signifies the causative agent of damage, illegibility, or other loss of original text.

classSpec.desc: Attributes for identification of the extent of editorial assertions

attDef.desc: indicates the extent of damage or omission.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that identify the reason why an editorial feature is used

attDef.desc: holds a short phrase describing the reason for missing textual material (gap), why material is supplied (supplied), or why transcription is difficult (unclear).

classSpec.desc: Attributes for elements encoding authorial or scribal intervention when transcribing manuscript or similar sources
Attributes that associate a feature corresponding with all or part of an image

attDef.desc: permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.
the number of columns spanned by this cell.
the number of rows spanned by this cell.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that describe a fret location

attDef.desc: records the location at which a string should be stopped against a fret.
contains a reference to a <chordDef> element elsewhere in the document.
indicates the presence of an extension symbol, typically a dash or underscore, drawn from the end of the harmonic indication to the point indicated by the dur attribute.
describes how the harmonic indication should be rendered.

valItem.desc: chord tablature grid and the element's textual content

classSpec.desc: Temporal alignment attributes. This class of attributes is unavailable unless the meiLinkAlign module is included.

attDef.desc: indicates the point of occurrence of this feature along a time line. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

classSpec.desc: Logical domain attributes. The n attribute should be used for verse numbers. Numbers need not be consecutive; they may also be expressed as ranges, e.g. 2-3,6.

attDef.desc: used to indicate a common, usually centered, refrain (Mup User's Guide, p. 44).
used to specify a rhythm for the lyric syllables that differs from that of the notes on the staff, e.g. '4,4,4,4' when the rhythm of the notes is '4.,8,4.,8'.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that record MIDI channel information

attDef.desc: records a MIDI channel value.
specifies the 'on' part of the duty cycle as a percentage of a note's duration.
sets the MIDI port value.
sets the MIDI track.

classSpec.desc: Attributes that record MIDI instrument information

attDef.desc: sets the MIDI instrument number.
provides a General MIDI label for the MIDI instrument.

MIDI number
indicates the number of pulses (sometimes referred to as ticks or divisions) per quarter note. Unlike MIDI, MEI permits different values for a score and individual staves.

permits any element from the XSLT namespace. Allowing XSLT in <incipit> makes it possible to generate the incipit from the notational content of the MEI file. Does this violate the principal of explicit markup?

groups elements that modify neume-like features.

groups elements that may appear as part of a bibliographic description.
groups elements that contain the text of a caption or other text displayed along with a figure.

groups elements that represent alternative endings.

groups elements used to represent a textual or musical incipit.

groups milestone-style elements found in text.

groups elements that denote a number or a quantity.
groups elements which may appear as part of the paragraph content model. A paragraph may contain inline elements and all the other block-level elements except lg and itself.
groups elements that represent a separate performer part.
groups elements that group separate performer parts.
groups elements that mark typographical features.
groups elements that denote a corporate entity that holds a bibliographic item.

groups textual elements that occur as part of the representation of the score, as opposed to the textual matter which accompanies it. This class is equivalent to the model.textphraseLike class without the pb element.
